TopicTitle: In Honor Of The Late Whackjob....

Articles.Content:
I am now following my most ambitious project yet.

It is time.....

To....

Build an orbital elevator on the Mun! I've set an height of 3KM as the "shortest possible height", and am considering heights of up to 20KM for the elevator.

The main structure of the elevator would be tanks, but there would be lots of ladders and facilities for extracting Munar material with Extraplanetary launchpad.

I have decided to name the elevator the Whack, and the proposed surronding area the "Job".

So, any idea of how to get this thing working? My first attempt resulted in a frozen screen and a restart; and it corrupted my save. So no, no pictures.

Yet (Muahahahahahaha)
I'd go for Gilly. It alows you to reduce the base diameter and you don't need lots of height to "jump" off and orbit with RCS.
Whackjob's not late. It's just taking him a while to load.

gilly is a bit too far, but I'd say the best bet would be minmus's "greater flats", would be the best, its very flat, has low gravity (but not gilly low) and has a smaller radius. Biggest thing of all with minmus is that its not that far from Kerbin..

btw : is this a forum wide project or personal ?

Whackjob's not late. It's just taking him a while to load.

I believe his PC finally imploded from his "small" craft designs
I don't mean to burst your bubble, but 2km is the maximum size object in KSP. I know this because of Whackjob.

I've set an height of 3KM as the "shortest possible height", and am considering heights of up to 20KM for the elevator.

And the 2.5km maximum physics distance doesn't worry you at all?

I don't mean to burst your bubble, but 2km is the maximum size object in KSP. I know this because of Whackjob.

There's this little thing called "mods". They're great, and they can make your game much more awesome.

There's this little thing called "mods". They're great, and they can make your game much more awesome.

What mod changes this?

What mod changes this?

I believe there is a mod that changes the distance to about 100KM or something, or is that just the physics?

But 2KM on Minmus will do.

I'm looking forward to seeing this. But if you think that 3km is to short, go for 42.14km on Gilly. That's the height for a gillystationary orbit, so you could put some kethane bases on the surface, use rovers to get the fuel you mined to your elevator and you can use it as an infinite refueling station.
I support this. Godspeed, good sir!

I believe there is a mod that changes the distance to about 100KM or something, or is that just the physics?

But 2KM on Minmus will do.

I think that's 100% graphics. I wouldn't be surprised if trying to get around the max physics distance by plugin would result in either disappointing nothings or massive explosions scattering debris across the universe.
Romfarer's dlls by default set the physics bubble radius to 100km. I used to use the docking cam, and every time my big space station passed over I would get massive lag
Good luck. If you can somehow fill the void in our hearts that Whackjob has temporarily left, may your mission be a rousing success.

This definitely sounds useful.

I might have to try and do this too

maybe if I melt my current computer, I'll have an excuse to build a better one

I'm going to the Mun.

With the biggest ship I can possibly build.

Pics incoming!

if no one minds my asking,

what exactly happened to Whackjob?

I asked Whack to get a Paypal account going where I can donate my Dollar for his new computer.

That guys really deserves our help because he got us stunning with almost every post he did on the forum.

if no one minds my asking,

what exactly happened to Whackjob?

His computer finally gave up. Probably destroyed itself to save us all.

The most Whckjobian ship I could come up with. If you're wondering about the flag, it's because Kerbin always seems to lag for me, so it fits the theme. If anyone has a better flag, please post it.

If you can guess what the acronym stands for, free rep and a free internet!

Edited March 18, 2014 by The Jedi Master

His computer finally gave up. Probably destroyed itself to save us all.

Not sure if that was a Christian joke... But I'm a Christian and I liked it

EDIT: In case of any misinterpretations, I meant nothing offensive by this post.

I suspect self-sacrifice is a concept not reserved solely for Christians, my friend

I suspect self-sacrifice is a concept not reserved solely for Christians, my friend

You're entirely right. That's just how my weird brain interprets things sometimes

Not sure if that was a Christian joke... But I'm a Christian and I liked it

Not a Christian joke, but still entertaining. I'm here all week.
